page.title: 19CASTLE HEATHER FARM
page.content:
On visiting{CASTLE HEATHER}the most notable feature is the beautiful, panoramic view. It sits at the top of a gently sloping hill, living up to its old Gaelic name{CAISTEAL LETHOIR}_ Castle of the Slope.
The remains of a twelfth century "moated homestead" is now just an earthwork mound with a ditch round three sides.
Today it is still farmed, mostly barley, but the farmer also runs an agricultural machinery rental business. He has many different types of machines which he rents out to the surrounding farms.
